detail.content: Histopathology Core | Office of Collaborative Science (OCS)                                       Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Office of Collaborative Science (OCS)                    RESEARCH CORES & SHARED RESOURCES                                                                                   Home   Cores and Shared Resources   Pricing   Who We Are                                  Home Cores and Shared Resources Histopathology Core            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                  Histopathology Core       The Histopathology Core, one component of the Experimental Pathology Shared Resource , provides services, instrumentation and training to facilitate the production of high quality tissue samples for morphological and molecular analyses for both animal model and clinical research. The Histopathology Core is tightly integrated with the Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Core , the second component of the Experimental Pathology Shared Resource.   Services offered by the Histopathology Core include tissue preparation, processing, sectioning and histochemical staining of both animal and fixed human tissues. All human samples are obtained athrough the closely affiliated Human Specimen Resource Center (HSRC) , or other IRB-approved sources. In addition, the Histopathology Core provides instrumentation that is available on a self-serve basis, such as a state-of the-art Laser Dissection Microscope, a microtome, a cryostat and a microscope fitted with a digital camera, and a digital whole slide scanner.       NEW! Digital Whole Slide Scanning   Order Forms   Services       Fees   Acknowledging Us   Contact Us             Contact Us  Phone: 212-263-3888  Email: histopath.core@nyumc.org     Location  Medical Science Building (MSB) 598  NYU Langone Medical Center  550 First Avenue  New York, NY 10016                                                                Announcements   Come visit us in our new location in MSB 598.   Citations   Mallen-St Clair, J. et al., EZH2 couples pancreatic regeneration to neoplastic progression. Genes & development 26, 439-444, (2012).   Nancy, P. et al., Chemokine gene silencing in decidual stromal cells limits T cell access to the maternal-fetal interface. Science 336:1317-21 (2012).   Ntziachristos, P., et al., Genetic inactivation of the polycomb repressive complex 2 in T cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Histopathology Core | Office of Collaborative Science (OCS)                                       Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Office of Collaborative Science (OCS)                    RESEARCH CORES & SHARED RESOURCES                                                                                   Home   Cores and Shared Resources   Pricing   Who We Are                                  Home Cores and Shared Resources Histopathology Core            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                  Histopathology Core       The Histopathology Core, one component of the Experimental Pathology Shared Resource , provides services, instrumentation and training to facilitate the production of high quality tissue samples for morphological and molecular analyses for both animal model and clinical research. The Histopathology Core is tightly integrated with the Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Core , the second component of the Experimental Pathology Shared Resource.   Services offered by the Histopathology Core include tissue preparation, processing, sectioning and histochemical staining of both animal and fixed human tissues. All human samples are obtained athrough the closely affiliated Human Specimen Resource Center (HSRC) , or other IRB-approved sources. In addition, the Histopathology Core provides instrumentation that is available on a self-serve basis, such as a state-of the-art Laser Dissection Microscope, a microtome, a cryostat and a microscope fitted with a digital camera, and a digital whole slide scanner.       NEW!
